result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM Defendant Vena Charles Olive in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by phone for Vena Charles Olive.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Detective Joel Clark S&T. Witness identifies the defendant in court. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. State efiles the information. Defense received and waived reading. NG plea entered.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:24 PM Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court received an email that Atty Goodrich is in Ozaukee County in a sentencing hearing and will have to reschedule this hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Avery Goodrich is appointed as counsel.
Payment to be determined at the end of the case.

As to: Vena Charles Olive re: Notice of Hearing and Petition for Appointment of Attorney

4:48 PM Defendant Vena Charles Olive appeared by phone, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Corey R. Hoze in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed the petition for the court appointed attorney. approved by the court. Vena Olive sworn in and testified. Defendant requested a lower cash bond, denied by the court.
